theme: Bar staff upsell + local promos on slow nights

avatar_style.persona: A friendly, approachable bar manager/bartender in their late 20s/early 30s, practical and efficient.
avatar_style.wardrobe: Casual but neat bar uniform (e.g., dark polo shirt or button-down, apron), comfortable and functional.
avatar_style.setting: A cozy, slightly dim neighborhood bar during a quiet period, with a prominent TV screen showing generic content, then Trillboards.

script.speaker: host
script.line: Ever had a slow night behind the bar, just wishing you could make those quiet hours work harder?
script.broll_cue: Bartender casually cleaning bar, looking at a quiet, empty section. TV in background is off or showing muted generic content.

script.speaker: host
script.line: That unused TV? We turned ours into a local billboard with Trillboards. It’s software-only, no extra gadgets.
script.broll_cue: Bartender pulls out phone, taps on it. TV in background subtly changes to show a Trillboards content card (e.g., daily special).

script.speaker: host
script.line: Seriously, just scan a QR, pick a template—we do our daily specials, and add local promos. Super simple setup.
script.broll_cue: Close-up on phone showing Trillboards app: scanning QR, selecting 'Bar Specials' template, then adding a 'Local Offers' slot. TV in background cycles content.

script.speaker: host
script.line: It's not 'ads,' it’s community engagement. We earn an extra $10 to $40 on a good night, just by showcasing nearby events or offers. It varies, of course, based on traffic.
script.broll_cue: Focus on the TV screen displaying a local cafe's 'Happy Hour' offer or a local band's gig. Pan slightly to show a few patrons glancing at it. Bartender smiles knowingly.

script.speaker: host
script.line: And you can swap cards on the fly. Just make sure your venue's cool with it, and always prefer local partners. Trillboards: Turn downtime into revenue.
script.broll_cue: Quick cut to bartender pulling up the app and swapping a card. TV instantly updates. Final shot of TV displaying a series of varied local promos and the Trillboards logo. Fade to black with logo.

caption_overlay.text: Slow night at the bar? Make your TV work for you!
Turn unused screens into local billboards with Trillboards – software only.
Scan a QR, pick a template, add local promos. Super easy setup!
It's community engagement! Earn $10-$40/night promoting local offers. (Varies by traffic)
Swap cards on the fly. Get venue permission, support local. Trillboards: Downtime to revenue.

secondary: Subtle bar sounds (clinking glasses, low chatter)

trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Quick, hardware-free setup to get started, leveraging existing screens.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Setting up content flow (e.g., bar specials, then local promos)
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Automates playlist creation, saving time and ensuring consistent rotation.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Monetizing screen time during off-peak hours
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Generates additional, variable income for the venue without extra staff effort.

trillboards_touchpoints.action: Dynamic content management from a phone
trillboards_touchpoints.why_it_helps: Keeps content fresh and responsive to real-time needs or changes without interrupting service.

constraints_and_risks: Always get explicit venue owner/manager permission before activating Trillboards for earning.
Avoid promoting businesses that directly compete with the host venue (e.g., another bar's drink special, unless it's a specific, approved cross-promotion).
Earnings are variable and depend on foot traffic, location, and advertiser demand, so avoid over-promising.
Ensure content is family-friendly and appropriate for the venue's audience and local regulations.

metrics_hypothesis.shareability_notes: Highly shareable among small business owners, bar/restaurant staff, hospitality industry groups, and side-hustle enthusiasts. The tangible earning potential and ease of use are strong draws.

alt_hooks: Your bar's TV: just decoration, or a hidden revenue stream?
What if your slow nights could actually *pay* you back?
alt_pacing: story_first_then_steps: Focus more on the 'problem' of slow nights and the 'discovery' of Trillboards before diving into exact steps.
faster_emphasis_on_steps: Quicker cuts and more rapid explanation of the Trillboards app flow.

rights_and_clearance_notes: Requires clearance for any visible local business logos (if not generic placeholders). Music track should be royalty-free. Talent release for host.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Wide shot of a slightly quiet, cozy neighborhood bar during off-peak hours (e.g., late afternoon/early evening on a weekday). A friendly, relatable male bartender/manager (late 20s/early 30s) in a dark polo shirt and apron is casually wiping down the bar counter. He glances at a large, blank TV screen mounted on the wall. Soft, warm lighting from practical bar lights.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Establishes the character, setting, and base visual style for the entire video. The TV should be prominent.
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Slow, subtle zoom in on the bartender's face as he sighs, then pans slightly to the blank TV.
scene_breakdown.lighting_notes: Warm, inviting bar lighting; slightly dim to emphasize the 'slow night' feel, but well-lit enough for character clarity.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. Bartender pulls out his smartphone. As he taps the screen, the TV behind him subtly flickers on and begins displaying a dynamic Trillboards content card, first showing a 'Daily Special' for the bar (e.g., '$5 Craft Beers').
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain same character, lighting, and setting. Ensure smooth transition of TV content.
key_visual_elements: TV screen now active with Trillboards content
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Slight push-in on the bartender and phone, with the TV remaining in the background. Focus shifts between phone and TV.
scene_breakdown.lighting_notes: Same warm bar lighting. The TV screen provides its own subtle illumination.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. Close-up shot on the bartender's hands as he navigates the Trillboards app on his phone. Show him scanning a simulated QR code, then quickly tapping through options: selecting a 'Bar Specials' template, and then adding a slot for 'Local Promos.' The TV in the background visually updates with new content reflecting these choices.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain consistent character's hands, phone, and TV appearance. Emphasize ease of use.
key_visual_elements: Bartender's hands and phone (clear UI of Trillboards app)
TV screen cycling through new content (bar specials, then a placeholder for local promo)
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Tight shot on phone, with blurred TV in background. Quick cuts between UI actions and TV updates.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. The TV screen now prominently displays a local business promo card (e.g., 'Yoga Class – First Session Free!' or 'Local Bakery – 10% Off'). A few casual patrons are at the bar, one briefly glances at the TV. The bartender is seen smiling, perhaps briefly engaging with a customer, indicating satisfaction.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain character, setting, and lighting. Show the practical application and subtle impact.
key_visual_elements: TV screen with specific local promo
Bartender interacting briefly with customer/looking content
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Slight pan from TV to bartender's satisfied expression. Maybe a quick, subtle head nod from a patron looking at the screen.

scene_breakdown.prompt_text: Continue from last frame. Bartender quickly pulls up his phone again and with a couple of taps, swaps the current promo on the TV to a different local offer (e.g., a 'Dry Cleaning Discount' or 'Local Band Gig Tonight'). The TV instantly updates. Final shot is a clean display of the Trillboards logo on the TV, followed by a quick fade to black.
scene_breakdown.continuity_notes: Maintain character, setting, and lighting. Show dynamic content changes. Conclude clearly.
key_visual_elements: Bartender's hands on phone, making a quick change
TV screen instantly updating with new local promo
scene_breakdown.camera_instruction: Quick cut back to phone and TV, demonstrating the speed of change. Hold on the Trillboards logo on TV for 2 seconds before a quick fade to black.
